user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is: A project shall not contain unreachable code.

</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of MHD_add_to_fd_set_:
```c
int
MHD_add_to_fd_set_ (MHD_socket fd,
                    fd_set *set,
                    MHD_socket *max_fd,
                    int fd_setsize)
{
  if ( (NULL == set) ||
       (MHD_INVALID_SOCKET == fd) )
    return 0;

#ifndef HAS_FD_SETSIZE_OVERRIDABLE
  (void) fd_setsize;  /* Mute compiler warning */
  fd_setsize = (int) FD_SETSIZE; /* Help compiler to optimise */
#endif /* ! HAS_FD_SETSIZE_OVERRIDABLE */

  if (! MHD_SCKT_FD_FITS_FDSET_SETSIZE_ (fd,
                                         set,
                                         fd_setsize))
    return 0;
  MHD_SCKT_ADD_FD_TO_FDSET_SETSIZE_ (fd,
                                     set,
                                     fd_setsize);
  if ( (NULL != max_fd) &&
       ( (fd > *max_fd) ||
         (MHD_INVALID_SOCKET == *max_fd) ) )
    *max_fd = fd;
  return ! 0;
}
```
</target_code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
suspicious_frags:
#ifndef HAS_FD_SETSIZE_OVERRIDABLE
  (void) fd_setsize;  /* Mute compiler warning */
  fd_setsize = (int) FD_SETSIZE; /* Help compiler to optimise */
#endif /* ! HAS_FD_SETSIZE_OVERRIDABLE */
explanation: All other fragments in the function are either syntactic (function header, braces, comments) or simple linear code that does not introduce additional conditional/compile-time variation that could produce unreachable code. The only places where unreachable code could plausibly arise are: the early conditional return (NULL set or invalid fd), the conditional compilation block (#ifndef ... / #endif) that may be omitted/modified by build-time macros, the conditional runtime check that returns early (MHD_SCKT_FD_FITS_FDSET_SETSIZE_), the macro invocation that may expand differently across configurations (MHD_SCKT_ADD_FD_TO_FDSET_SETSIZE_), the conditional update of *max_fd (which has a compound condition), and the final return. Those fragments are reported above for further investigation. No other statements or branches exist in the supplied code that could be unreachable.
